content.title: GITANJALI HOUSING SCHEME
content.details: The Gitanjali Housing Scheme aims to provide housing for homeless people in West Bengal, focusing on the Economically Weaker Section (EWS) of society. The scheme is implemented in rural and non-Municipal urban areas in coordination with several government departments.
benefits: Provides proper shelter to the economically weaker section of society
Creates additional employment opportunities for construction workers
Assists homeless individuals in building shelters
Supports rural people who are homeless due to financial weakness
Helps those affected by natural disasters to build houses
Returns lost land to farmers for cultivation
eligibility: Homeless individuals who are citizens of West Bengal
People who have become homeless due to floods or other natural calamities
Poor people in rural and urban areas
Individuals with a family income of Rs. 6000/- per month or less
exclusions: Not everyone may be eligible to apply, as restrictions may apply to specific income groups
Limited number of residential units available under the scheme
documents_required: Identity proof (Aadhaar card, voter ID, PAN card, passport, or driving license)
Address proof (Aadhaar card, voter ID, electricity bill, water bill, or telephone bill)
Income certificate issued by a competent authority
Proof of age (birth certificate, school leaving certificate, or passport)
Any other document specified by the government or housing development authority

faqs.question: What is the Gitanjali Housing Scheme?
faqs.answer: The Gitanjali Housing Scheme is a residential scheme launched by the West Bengal Government to provide affordable housing to the people of the state.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to apply for the Gitanjali Housing Scheme?
faqs.answer: Applicants must be citizens of India, residents of West Bengal, at least 18 years of age, and belong to the economically weaker section (EWS) or low-income group (LIG) category as defined by the government of West Bengal.

faqs.question: How can I apply for the Gitanjali Housing Scheme?
faqs.answer: Interested applicants can complete their registration online through the official website of the West Bengal Housing Infrastructure Development Corporation (WBHIDCO) or through the offline mode by collecting and submitting the application form at the designated offices.

faqs.question: What are the documents required to apply for the Gitanjali Housing Scheme?
faqs.answer: The documents required to apply for the Gitanjali Housing Scheme generally include identity proof, address proof, income certificate, bank account details, photographs, proof of age, and any other document specified by the government or the housing development authority.

faqs.question: Can I apply for the Gitanjali Housing Scheme if I already own a house?
faqs.answer: No, applicants who already own a pucca house in their name or in the name of their family members in West Bengal are not eligible to apply for the Gitanjali Housing Scheme.
